perturbation.original_text:
6.
WARRANTY.
6.1 DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTY. iPASS AND ALL iPASS SUPPLIERS EXPRESSLY DISCLAIM ANY AND ALL WARRANTIES,
CONDITIONS, AND REPRESENTATIONS OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY,INCLUDING ANY WARRANTIES OF
MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NEITHER iPASS NOR ANY iPASS SUPPLIER WILL BE LIABLE FOR ANY
THIRD-PARTY NETWORK FAILURE. iPASS AND ITS SUPPLIERS SPECIFICALLY DO NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES WILL MEET
CHANNEL PARTNER’S OR END USER REQUIREMENTS, WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED, TIMELY, SECURE, ERROR FREE, AVAILABLE ON A
SPECIFIED DATE OR TIME OR WILL HAVE THE CAPACITY TO MEET CHANNEL PARTNER’S OR END USER DEMAND DURING SPECIFIC
HOURS. CHANNEL PARTNER ACKNOWLEDGES THAT IT HAS NOT ENTERED INTO THIS AGREEMENT IN RELIANCE UPON ANY
WARRANTY OR REPRESENTATION.
perturbation.changed_text:
6.
WARRANTY.
6.1 DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTY. iPASS AND ALL iPASS SUPPLIERS EXPRESSLY DISCLAIM ALL WARRANTIES TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW. iPASS AND ITS SUPPLIERS SPECIFICALLY DO NOT WARRANT THAT THE SERVICES WILL MEET
CHANNEL PARTNER’S OR END USER REQUIREMENTS. CHANNEL PARTNER ACKNOWLEDGES THAT IT HAS NOT ENTERED INTO THIS AGREEMENT IN RELIANCE UPON ANY
WARRANTY OR REPRESENTATION.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause disclaims all warranties, including implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose, and any statutory warranties. The modified clause weakens this by saying that iPass disclaims ALL warranties "to the extent permitted by law", but removing the explicit disclaimers of implied and statutory warranties eliminates legally required consumer protections. This introduces legal risk, particularly in California, where implied warranties are difficult to disclaim entirely.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Commercial Code §§ 2314, 2315, which imply warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose.

perturbation.original_text:
9.
LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY.
9.1 DIRECT DAMAGES. EACH PARTY’S MAXIMUM LIABILITY FOR DAMAGES CAUSED BY ITS FAILURE TO PERFORM ITS
OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE AGREEMENT IS LIMITED TO: (A) PROVEN DIRECT DAMAGES FOR CLAIMS ARISING OUT OF PERSONAL
INJURY OR DEATH, OR DAMAGE TO TANGIBLE PROPERTY CAUSED BY THE PARTY’S NEGLIGENT OR WILLFUL MISCONDUCT; AND (B)
PROVEN DIRECT DAMAGES FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS ARISING FROM OR IN CONNECTION WITH OR RELATING TO THIS
AGREEMENT OR THE LICENSED SOFTWARE OR SERVICES, NOT TO EXCEED AN AMOUNT EQUAL TO THE AMOUNT OF FEES
ACTUALLY PAID BY CHANNEL PARTNER TO IPASS DURING THE SIX (6) MONTHS PRECEDING THE FIRST EVENT GIVING RISE TO SUCH
LIABILITY. ALL CLAIMS AGAINST THE PARTIES WILL BE AGGREGATED TO DETERMINE SATISFACTION OF THIS LIMIT, AND MULTIPLE
CLAIMS WILL NOT ENLARGE THE LIMIT.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.
LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY.
9.1 DIRECT DAMAGES. EACH PARTY’S MAXIMUM LIABILITY FOR DAMAGES CAUSED BY ITS FAILURE TO PERFORM ITS
OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE AGREEMENT IS LIMITED TO: (B)
PROVEN DIRECT DAMAGES FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS ARISING FROM OR IN CONNECTION WITH OR RELATING TO THIS
AGREEMENT OR THE LICENSED SOFTWARE OR SERVICES, NOT TO EXCEED AN AMOUNT EQUAL TO THE AMOUNT OF FEES
ACTUALLY PAID BY CHANNEL PARTNER TO IPASS DURING THE SIX (6) MONTHS PRECEDING THE FIRST EVENT GIVING RISE TO SUCH
LIABILITY. ALL CLAIMS AGAINST THE PARTIES WILL BE AGGREGATED TO DETERMINE SATISFACTION OF THIS LIMIT, AND MULTIPLE
CLAIMS WILL NOT ENLARGE THE LIMIT.
perturbation.explanation: This change omits the exception for personal injury, death, or damage to tangible property caused by negligence. In California, it is generally against public policy to limit liability for damages resulting from gross negligence, willful misconduct, or violations of law. Removing the explicit carve-out for these types of damages creates a legal contradiction.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code § 1668, which prohibits contracts that exempt responsibility for fraud, willful injury, or violation of law.

perturbation.original_text:
9.3 EXCLUSIONS. CHANNEL PARTNER’S PAYMENT OBLIGATIONS, LIABILITY FOR EARLY TERMINATION FEES OR CHARGES,
BREACHES OF CONFIDENTIALITY BY EITHER PARTY, MISAPPROPRIATION OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS OF THE OTHER PARTY,
AND THE PARTIES’ INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE EXCLUDED FROM THESE LIMITATIONS OF
LIABILITY.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.3 EXCLUSIONS. CHANNEL PARTNER’S PAYMENT OBLIGATIONS, LIABILITY FOR EARLY TERMINATION FEES OR CHARGES,
BREACHES OF CONFIDENTIALITY BY EITHER PARTY, AND MISAPPROPRIATION OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS OF THE OTHER PARTY ARE EXCLUDED FROM THESE LIMITATIONS OF
LIABILITY.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes 'THE PARTIES’ INDEMNIFICATION OBLIGATIONS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE EXCLUDED FROM THESE LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY.' This allows iPass to limit their liability even in cases where they are contractually obligated to indemnify Channel Partner, potentially leaving Channel Partner exposed to significant losses. This is a consumer right, the right to indemnification, which protects channel partner against third party legal action. Removing the indemnification obligation makes the contract non-compliant.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law relating to breach of contract and Indemnification.
